p: Leprosy. In Africa, the number of new cases of leprosy has declined every year since 2001 [35]. At the beginning of 2008, approximately 30,055 cases of leprosy were registered in Africa with 31,037 new cases in 2007 ( Table 2) [35]. These represent approximately 14% and 12% of the global prevalence and new cases, respectively ( Table 2). In SSA, the highest registered prevalence occurs in DRC (6,502 cases), followed by Nigeria (5,381), Ethiopia (4,611), and Mozambique (1,830) ( Table 3) [35]. Similarly, in 2007, the largest number of new cases occured in DRC (8,820), Nigeria (46,650), Ethiopia (4,187), and Mozambique (2,610) [35].
